description: Valid examples of multi-condition elseif chains

input.natural_language: Assign letter grade: A (>=90), B (>=80), C (>=70), F (else)

expected_output.quantum_code:
<q:if condition="{score} >= 90">
  Grade: A
<q:elseif condition="{score} >= 80"/>
  Grade: B
<q:elseif condition="{score} >= 70"/>
  Grade: C
<q:else/>
  Grade: F
</q:if>
expected_output.runtime_behavior: Evaluates conditions in order, stops at first match

input.natural_language: Classify age: child (<13), teen (13-17), adult (18-64), senior (65+)

expected_output.quantum_code:
<q:if condition="{age} < 13">
  Category: Child
<q:elseif condition="{age} < 18"/>
  Category: Teen
<q:elseif condition="{age} < 65"/>
  Category: Adult
<q:else/>
  Category: Senior
</q:if>

input.natural_language: Set priority: critical (>90), high (>70), medium (>40), low (else)

expected_output.quantum_code:
<q:if condition="{urgency} > 90">
  Priority: Critical
<q:elseif condition="{urgency} > 70"/>
  Priority: High
<q:elseif condition="{urgency} > 40"/>
  Priority: Medium
<q:else/>
  Priority: Low
</q:if>
expected_output.runtime_behavior: Determines priority level from urgency score
